title: Code generation of the concurrency mechanisms of VDM++
body: Integrate the current work on code generation of the VDM++ concurrency mechanisms based on the work of @gkanos and make it available as a prototype. By toggling a flag the user should be able to choose whether the concurrency mechanisms should be code generated or not.

title: Problem converting composed function values
Type check: of the || operator in traces is missing
body:
The type check of the || operator is completely ignores. See the spec below for an example

~~~
class A

operations

traces
    T2: 
        || (getn(1), getn(true)); 

end A
~~~

title: Second half of implication needlessly evaluated in class invariant
body:
I discovered this issue while looking at #390.

If we have a reference to another object in an instance variable and we use it in the class invariant, it will always be looked up. Even if it's not necessary. That makes it impossible to guard against `nil` references.

Minimum example below:
```
class A
instance variables 
private x : nat := 1;
private other : [A] := nil;
inv other <> nil => other.x = 1;

operations
public static test : () ==> ()
test() == let a = new A() in skip
end A
```

title: IO`freadval uses the default character encoding
body:
The IO`freadval function currently uses the Java default character encoding (ie. -Dfile.encoding), rather than the VDMJ specification encoding (eg. -c UTF8). It would be less confusing if the specification and any files that it reads were both the same file encoding - the one that is set in the tool with "-c".

Longer term, it might be better to modify the library so that fradval can be passed an encoding. But that is a matter for the LB, who look after the libraries.

title: Problem with || operator in combinatorial tests
Problem with object reference compares in postconditions
body:
There is a problem where object reference equality was comparing Java object references rather than VDMJ references. This leads to some failures, such as the following:
```
	class A
	instance variables
		obj : B := new B();
	
	operations
		public op: () ==> ()
		op() == skip
		post obj~ = obj   -- Fails here!
	
	end A

	class B
	end B
```

This spec fails the postcondition because the old value of "obj" is a different Java object to the current value, but in VDMJ terms they both refer to the same object instance and so this test should pass.

title: Code generator hangs with no error
body:
The following trivial example (project CGTest, file Test.vdmpp) stalls when asked to code generate with "Starting VDM++ to Java code generation..." but no other information:

    class Test

    functions
 
    Foo: nat -> nat 
    Foo(x) == x + 1

    end Test

I'm running 2.1.2 Windows x86 Java 7u71. AlarmPP and CashDispenserPP both code generate fine.

title: Choosing what classes should be code generated to Java
body: Sometimes it does not make sense to code generate every VDM class. This may be the case if a class acts as en entry point of a model or it loads data used in the simulation and so on. Therefore it would be useful to be able to explicitly select which classes should be code generated to avoid producing code that is not needed.

title: Can't generate Java code.
body: I had Java 8 installed and tried to generate Java code, but got this error: Starting VDM++ to Java code generation... Unexpected exception caught when attempting to code generate VDM model. null The VDM++ example is fine (copied from a example, and got friends who sucessfully generated the Java code, but they have Java 7 installed). So, I installed Java 7, but still got this error. Any idea of what's the problem?

title: Type constraint error with unary minus
body:
The following specification is giving an error:
```
types
	S = int;
	U = nat
	
values
	s:S = -123;
	u:U = -s;         -- Reports value is not of the right type.
```
This is a small problem in the type checking of unary minus expressions.

title: Interpreter crashes on evaluation of the 'is'-expression when the checked type is recursively defined
body:
The interpreter fails to evaluate Entry`Run() in the spec below.

The problem appears in both Overture and VDMJ.

The description of the problem as given by NB is: The problem is that the type checker as passed the type definitions, because it is possible that a value of T1 or T2 is <C>. But when the "is_" construct is evaluated, it is attempting to convert the <C> value to T1, which is T2, which is <C>|T1, and evidently it is trying the T1 case first - just the luck of the order of the types in the union set.

~~~
class Entry

types

public T1 = T2;

public T2 = <C> | T1;

operations

public static Run : () ==> ?
Run () ==
                return [is_(<C>, T1), is_(<D>, T1)];

end Entry
~~~

title: Java 7 dependency in the ctruntime tests
body: In the ctruntime tests there is a Java 7 dependency (java.nio.file), which must be removed.

title: Removing the vdmj_compatibility_tests projects from the code base
body: At some point we should take out the vdmj_compatibility_tests projects. I do not think we use them anymore. @joey-coleman  do you have any input on this?

title: Inherited definition not visible in the sync section
VDMTools fails to open
body:
Problem Occurred Window Appeared: The contents is following.

    Failed to open VDM Tools
    Cannot run program "/Applications/The\ VDM++\ Toolbox/bin/vppgde.app/Contents/MacOS/vppgde" (in directory "/Users/sahara/workspace4_2.0.1/Library4HoseiE/generated"): error=2, No such file or directory

title: Bug of comp operator?
Error Object Pattern?
body:
I’ve tested attached VDM++ model.

I met the following error.

ssmbp2013:Object_Pattern sahara$ vdmj Obj_Pattern.vdmpp
Error 2149: Expecting '->' after case pattern list in 'ObjP' (Obj_Pattern.vdmpp) at line 16:21
Error 2060: Expecting 'end <name>' after class members in 'ObjP' (Obj_Pattern.vdmpp) at line 18:9
Bye

VDMTools is OK, and I think the syntax is OK.


    class ObjP

    instance variables
    person : Person;
    dept : Department;

    functions
    /*
	Examples: Using an object pattern,  an object can be matched by values of instance variables. 
	The following simple example gives <STUDENT> if and only if the object reference person points 
	at an instance of the class Student, otherwise <NOT STUDENT>.
    */
    public isStudent : Person +> <STUDENT> | <NOT_STUDENT>
    isStudent(aPerson) ==
    cases aPerson:
        obj_Student() -> <STUDENT>,
        others -> <NOT_STUDENT>
    end;

    /*The following example in addition matches the instance variable name against "John".
    */
    public isJohn : Person +> <JOHN> | <NOT_A_STUDENT_OR_NOT_JOHN>
    isJohn(aPerson) ==
        cases aPerson:
            obj_Student(name |-> "John") -> <JOHN>,
            others -> <NOT_A_STUDENT_OR_NOT_JOHN>
        end;

    /*
    An object pattern can also bind the value of instance variable. 
    For example, the following expression gives the name of person if person is an instance of the class Student.
    */
    public getStudentName : Person +> Person`Name
    getStudentName(aPerson) ==
        cases aPerson:
        obj_Student(name |-> n) -> n,
        others -> ""
        end;

    /*
	An object pattern may contain another object pattern. 
	The following expression gives the name and department concatenated by "@" for students,
	and add the title for professors.
    */
    public getName : Person +> Person`Name
    getName(aPerson) ==
        cases aPerson:
        obj_Student(name |-> n, dept |-> obj_Department(name |->dname))        -> n^"@"^dname,
        obj_Professor(name |-> n) -> "Prof. "^n,
        others -> ""
        end;
 
        operations
        public sortedProfList : seq of Person ==> map char to set of seq of char
        sortedProfList(ps) == 
                return 
                        cases ps:
                        [] -> {|->},
                        [obj_Professor(name |-> [n]^ns)]^rest ->
                                let
                                        list = sortedProfList(rest),
                                        index = n,
                                        name = "Prof."^[n]^ns,
                                         names = if index in set dom list then list(index) else {}
                               in
                                list ++ {index |-> names union {name}},
                        [-]^rest -> sortedProfList(rest)
                        end;

        end ObjP
 
        class Person
        types
        public Name = seq of char;

        instance variables
        public name : Name := "anonymous" ;
        public dept : Department;
        end Person

        class Student is subclass of Person
        operations
        public Student : Name * Department ==> Student
        Student(nm, dp) == (
                name := nm;
                dept := dp
        )
        end Student

        class Professor is subclass of Person
        operations
        public Professor : Name * Department ==> Professor
        Professor(nm, dp) == (
	        name := nm;
	        dept := dp
        )
        end Professor

        class Department
        types
        public Name = seq of char;

        instance variables
        public name : Name := "anonymous" 

        operations
        public Department : Name ==> Department
        Department(nm) == name := nm;
        end Department

        class UseObjP
        instance variables
        op : ObjP := new ObjP();

        traces
        T1:	op.isStudent(new Student("John", new Department("CS")));
			op.isStudent(new Professor("John", new Department("CS")))
        T2:
			op.isJohn(new Student("John", new Department("CS")));
			op.isJohn(new Student("Shin", new Department("CS")));
			op.isJohn(new Professor("John", new Department("CS")))
        T3:
			op.getStudentName(new Student("John", new Department("CS")));
			op.getStudentName(new Professor("John", new Department("CS")))
        T4:
			op.getName(new Student("John", new Department("CS")));
			op.getName(new Professor("John", new Department("CS")))
        T5:
			op.sortedProfList([
					new Student("Shin", new Department("CS")),
					new Professor("Peter", new Department("CS")),
					new Professor("John", new Department("CS")),
					new Professor("Keijirou", new Department("CSR"))
			]);

        end UseObjP

title: Outline Icon for functions
body:
*This is a fairly minor request but I'm writing it up so it gets documented.*

It would be nice, in the outline, to have different icons for functions and operations. If you sort the outline alphabetically (and even in normal sort), it can get complicated to tell if a definition is a function or an operation.

It's also confusing to see functions mixed in with static ops since the icon is the same but functions are missing the `s` overlay.

title: Possibly a type checking issue with bracket types
body:
The type checker stalls when type checking the spec below.

~~~
class Entry

operations

public static op : ((nat * nat)) ==> nat
op (mk_(a,b)) ==
return a+b
post RESULT = 5;

end Entry
~~~

title: Changing the default language version of a VDM project to VDM10
body:
When you create a new VDM project in Overture the default language version is set to VDM classic.I think this should be changed to VDM10 as this is the version of VDM that is being maintained by the Language Board.

Does anybody recommend against this?

title: Tag Assistants with Interface
body:
There is some confusion between what does and does not constitute an "assistant".

We now have  a working definition: assistants are used in multiple packages.

We need to go over all the assistant classes and ensure that only proper assistants are connected to the factory system. These system should also be tagged with a hollow interface so it's easier to identify them.

The single-package assistants should be disconnected from the factory system and renamed to something else.

title: The CyberRail Example is broken
Ordering of files/folders in a VDM Explorer view
body:
In the past, files/folders in the VDM Explorer view (within an open project) have either been in case-senstive order or perhaps "folders-first" mode, such that "lib" and "generated" appear at the top, if they are present. Now these two folders get mixed up in the middle of other files in the project.

Can we sort them so that these folders are back at the top?

title: Proof Obliagtion Explorer doesn't refresh with spec changes
body:
> The following bug was [originally reported](https://sourceforge.net/p/overture/bugs/163/) on Sourceforge by [nick_battle](https://sourceforge.net/u/nick_battle/profile/), 2013-01-30 14:53:40.139000:

The Proof Obligation Explorer does not update its set of POs when the specification is edited and written away, meaning that you have to right-click the project and re-generate the POs to see an updated set.

Can this not happen automatically? Failing that, can we have a button on the view itself to refresh the POs?
